occurrences.text: position of not only power but great responsibility, we find that God had been preparing him all along the way. Turn to the New Testament, if you will, the book of Luke. I want to hold your place there in Genesis 41, but I want to show you two verses. You're familiar with the verses no doubt in the book of Luke, but I want you to look at Luke 16 and then we'll look at a verse over in Luke 19. And I want you to consider with me the time, the principle that we see here of preparation. I am thankful that through the the overview that I just provided you with all along the way in Joseph's life, we find that he was faithful. And because he was faithful, God was molding him and God was shaping him and he was in a position that when Pharaoh says, okay Joseph, you're the one, you're the one that's going to be in this position, that Joseph was ready for the task that was given to him. Notice in Luke chapter 16 and verse number 10, the Bible says, he that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much. And he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much. You know, a good indicator of the faithfulness of individuals is how do they handle the little things that are
